Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel and fit for purpose for a 1 night weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: PerantauDunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends in this hotel over the weekend. For the price we paid (just over â‚¬100 last minute booking), it was good value. In summary - if you're looking to have a cebtral location but don't plan to be spending a lot of time at the hotel, it's more than adequate. What you shouldn't expect is luxury and all your needs catered to, like a chain hotel would. With that in mind, this hotel is fine. However, I wouldn't stay here for longer than a 3 nights, it's not that comfortable for a long stay. Also consider the NH Doelen (part of the NH Hotel chain), which is just across the canal as sometimes they have similar rates according to the people we spoke with in Amsterdam. It looks like a much nicer hotel and I would certainly stay there if that's the case (it was fully booked when we asked). Pros and cons below: Pros Location: Excellent for the price. Walking distance everywhere. Room: Decent size (if you're not staying long!) Cons: 1. Bed was comfortable but pillows are too thin - could be thicker, but posed no problems for me. 2. Front desk reception wasn't curtious, but wasn't rude either - again not a problem for me. 3. Street noise - we had a room facing the canal and could hear street noise. This may be a problem for light sleepers. 4. No blackout blinds / curtains - so may be a problem if you want total darkness to sleep. Not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: spannerhc
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location - perfect for wandering all over Amsterdam. Yes, the rooms are a bit on the small side and it is a bit noisy due to traffic and people walking by - but it is in the centre of Amsterdam! The room was clean and the twin we stayed in was big enough to accommodate two people on a work trip. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was decent. Would recommend - but don't expect too much from the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kieron H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Amsterdam, and it was perfect for what we needed. I read a lot of reviews before hand to make sure we chose a good location, and this was absolutely superb. On the map it seemed potentially a bit far from the main square, but it's literally a five minute walk. There's also a small square roughly a minute away which has lots of bars and places to eat which is fantastic. If you're going for the first time, the airport is roughly 20 minutes away by train from the city centre (very easy to use and the ticket staff are very friendly), and the train station it arrives into is probably 15 minutes walk through the city centre to Hotel Nes. It's a great location for anything in the centre. We went to the ice bar, Heineken museum, red light district, etc, all within walking distance - and the trams are frequent and cheap if you need to use those too. In terms of the hotel itself, it was relatively basic, but we only used it to sleep in. The rooms were medium sized but the beds were comfy and the curtains kept the light out, so we couldn't really ask for much more. Big plus side was we could open our window right out and it overlooked the canal which is right outside the hotel, so it was good to sit there and watch the boats go buy in the morning. All in all a great place to stay at. The only downside was the price we paid (left it quite late to book).

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Robbie M
Reviews.Content: Very very disappointing. The room was tiny and dark. We had to climb over the bed to get to the tiny bathroom. Nowhere to sit in the room. No reading lights; broken shower; no hot water in the morning. We asked to change rooms because oiut room was unacceptable but we were told the hotel was fully booked. I feel we were cheated because we paid for a 3-star room and the room we were given was definitely a 0-star room. The staff didn't care and wouldn't do anything to help. We were still charged 3-star prices. If you ever go to this hotel and are offered room 118, leave immediately. Better not to bother with this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nainai99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in agreat location, only minutes away from Rembrandt Square which is fab for drinks in the evening or if you prefer the bright red lights then they are only a few minutes walk away too! We stayed in a room for 4 people and it was pretty basic to say the least, it was an odd shape too which meant that one of the beds was situated around the corner from the other three. It wsn't a problem though as we really didn't need to watch each other sleep!! If I were to go again I'd request a room facing the canal as the rooms at the back have no view at all. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and i'd definitely recommend the Nes if you want a buget hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: cmglin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Annex building in Room 11 which is around the corner from the hotel. We had a great view over the canal and the room was much bigger than the rooms in the hotel building. The room was very clean, two huge windows, chairs, table and very spacious for Amsterdam. The guy who checked us in was very helpful. The bathroom looked newish and the only downside was sometimes there was a smell from the drain in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “very basic but idealy located”
Reviews.Author: madziusssia
Reviews.Content: It's a small charming hotel right in the heart of the city within walking distance to all popular lociations. we've stayed in the canal room which was very basic and small only with a bed and a dated bathroom. Even a chair with a small table would make a big difference but I understand that there wouldn't be any room for that. If you're looking for a place just to have a warm and clean bed and a roof over your head-this would be a perfect option.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: lillian303631
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning in the room, if you give up air conditioning, sleeping with the window open subject to noises of the night, cars, people, if you give up the carpet in the bathroom when you leave the shower wet, if you not care to a old lady charging the coffee voucher at the breakfast in a bad mood ...room is very small, barely fits two people and two bags, if you don't mind for all this above, this is the hotel, so expensive for what it offers. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel but Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Kikibooboutique
Reviews.Content: For the price of the rooms I am flabergasted that they can charge over 300 euros for a 2 night stay?!! The rooms are too too small - You have to practically walk side ways everytime you want to move round your bed or have a shower. And the shower is a joke, the eaves of the buliding are very low, which meant you had to shower sitting down! How can this be a 3 star hotel?!!!! they also need to refurbished the very tired early 90's decor I would NEVER recommend this to anyone!! The location is superb - the cafe's right beside the hotel are very friendly and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder, great on location”
Reviews.Author: andrewswainwright
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a trip to Amsterdam with my girlfriend and two friends for Queens day and we booked two rooms in Hotel Nes. Like most people that use this site I ended up scouring the reviews before our stay to see such a contrast of opinions and wondered how people have such differing experiences. I consider myself to be fairly balanced when it comes to accommodation and can honestly say this hotel was absolutely perfect for what we needed. No it isn't five star luxury but it certainly doesn't claim to be. However, if you're looking for a decent, clean, well serviced and fantastically located hotel this is the one for you. Admittedly it wasn't the cheapest but I suspect the premium is justifiable simply based on it's great location. Furthermore, we booked on Queens day when all hotels were charging well over the odds. Either way, if you want a good secure base in Amsterdam to get out and about round the city this is perfect. Plus if you are spending that much time in your room to have such a strong negative opinion...what are you doing on a city break in Amsterdam...get out there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for your first trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: aandriolli
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small for the price - but it seems to be usual in Amsterdam. The location is excellent - we were visiting as tourists and we were able to do everything walking, as most tourist sights are nearby. Internet access is available but very expensive. On the first morning shower didn't have hot water, and there was no air conditioner in our room - and unexpectedly, we got very hot days while there. 10 EUR for their breakfast is honest.

Reviews.Title: “NES Hotel, central amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HenricB
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend. Very run down rooms at a way too high price. Unfriendly front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “clean and central, but not as good as their website”
Reviews.Author: Callanish
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel as it was listed in a New York Times list of budget hotels in Amsterdam, and as it was a last minute trip I was glad to get a room at all; the cost (95 euros per night) for a capital city was fair enough. The location is excellent. My room was clean, plenty of hot water, there was a hairdryer in the bathroom, staff were courteous, and I slept well. However, a small room here really does mean small, it makes London hotel rooms look palatial. Despite the fabulous photos and promotion of canal views on the website and even the promotional materials in the hotel itself, there are NO single rooms with a canal view; rather, single travellers are sent to the tiny rooms where it's best just to keep the curtains closed or you'll be looking through someone else's hotel window. Although breakfast was basic it was typical of many European budget hotels and perfectly acceptable, but definitely not worth the 10 euros charged for it. The cafe at the corner is excellent, for food or a quiet drink. If you're realistic about what to expect then this is a clean and comfortable budget hotel. If you're travelling solo and opt for a single room then be prepared for a view very different from the website. For just a very little more money I suspect it's possible to a better deal, especially off-season as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: micky2shoes
Reviews.Content: I wasn't put off by other reviews speaking of small rooms, etc, as i've been to amsterdam before, but perhaps i should have read a few more - how the hotel can charge â‚¬160 a night for a grim room, with ruined 1980s chipboard furniture, a TV set the size of a shoe box, a bath so close to the eaves it wasn't actually possible to shower without lying semi-prone, and then asking an extra â‚¬10 for breakfast. uncomfortable bed, and those freakishly sized 3/4 width duvets completed the disappointing picture. Amsterdam is a fine town, with some glorious hotels - this isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dubkean
Reviews.Content: Had severe difficulty getting a central hotel because the Amsterdam marathon was on the weekend we were there, so settled on Nes because of the location....which is unbeatable! Easy to get to from central station, close to everything, yet in a nice, quite enough area, the location is really perfect. The rooms are very small, basic but clean, a good 2 star - the problem was the 3 or 4 star price we paid! Totally overpriced the weekend I was there, but if I got it for about 85 euro I'd be happy enough. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment, but staff were pleasant - had a huge selection of phone chargers, which we could keep until check out. Overall, great location, pity about the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Alfreda31
Reviews.Content: Good location, on the Signel Canal, across the street from the flower market and near the main streer market, Old Town of Amsterdam, the canal rooms are lovely good views, breakfast isn't great, but staff where nice and rooms where fine, clean bright, has a lift! good spot, nice part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very expensive, good location”
Reviews.Author: jo-alt
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Nes is good as its central and you can walk to many of the attractions of Amsterdam. The reception is welcoming and attractive. Very narrow flight of stairs to get to our room, past laundry rooms and narrow corridors leading to what looks like staff quarters, no lift in the hotel. The room we stayed in was tiny and absolutely sparse. No hairdryer, safe or tea tray in the room. Beds were made in a hurry and the whole room experience quite cramped and characterless, bland. The breakfast was surprisingly good. Staff reasonably helpful. Would say their rates are way too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “book it only for the CENTRAL POSITION”
Reviews.Author: Maichi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small, all!! but the single ones are worst than the double. There are rooms both on the channel and behind the building, the singles are ALL behind. the personnel is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, off the busy tourist routes”
Reviews.Author: vaykaygal
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical about the location as it was further from the main attractions than we first thought. In the end I enjoyed it's location on the canal where there were not so many tourists. We ate at the cafe close by and everyone else there was Nederlanders. The only complaint is the shower had a sloping ceiling so we had to "shower" sitting in the tub. Certainly not the end of the world. For the price it was a decent room and a decent breakfast. I would stay here again when we next visit A'Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and views!”
Reviews.Author: Walkerd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a few places for the first time in Amsterdam which all had a pricey fee of 100 euros or more to have your own bathroom. I stayed at Hotel Nes on my last night in the Dam and found it to be a pretty reasonable place to stay (74 euros) for a single person. The breakfast was yummy and free along with a great view of downtown and a great location just off the main traffic of the Muni and buses. It didn't bother me that the shower was opened to the bathroom. I guess it's all about how much time you spend in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest rip off ever!”
Reviews.Author: jzbVienna
Reviews.Content: Absolutely dreadful! 140 Euros plus tax for the tiniest room ever with cheap, shabby furniture and uncomfortable beds. The shower didn't work properly and the bath had no plug. No toiletries in the bathroom. Just a shower cap. No hairdryer. The "desk"had a tiny TV set on it with a fuzzy picture showing local TV. There was no space to use the desk. There wasn't even enough space to put my suitcase on the floor. The hotel's website is very deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “High price for low value”
Reviews.Author: Kaupelei
Reviews.Content: It was the tiniest single bedroom (No 306 = ca 6m2) I ever had to cope with at a price of â‚¬ 95/night. The integrated bath/toilet offered no hairdryer, no floor mats nor minibar (arrived late in the night). It's nicely located though, was clean + quiet with the exception of roof work in front of the window starting 7am. Breakfast "choice" is cheap and minimalistic! Overall: DEFINETLY NOT WORTH THE PRICE!

Reviews.Title: “Only if there is no other choice”
Reviews.Author: tomer_NL
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, very unfriendly personnel. The bathroom (shower-room) is extra small and inconvenient - everything was wet after two minutes... We reserved a room with a bath, yet we got one with a shower. If you are stuck with no room - take it, if you can find something else - do yourself a favor

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: PearlieLupita
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute pick since we had problems at our original booked hotel. The front desk was rude. If you asked a questions you felt like you were bothering them. The lobby looks nice but the rooms were thrown together. They remodeled the rooms in the cheapest way possible. But, if you are only sleeping in the room it is okay. Nice view of the canal and the linens were clean. They gave us dirty towels and i didn't notice until after i got out of the shower. When I called downstairs for new ones - they sent someone to the room and he wouldn't give me the new towels until I showed him the dirty one that I had wrapped around me! So rude. Then he proceeded to inspect the towel in front of me. When he saw the dirty marks he shrugged and walked away. Then we asked that nobody enter our room and when we returned they had cleaned it. The included breakfast was not bad. Bottom Line: You could get a better place for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in a lovely Hotel contrary to the reports I read .”
Reviews.Author: Rastrickian
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel because of it's location and were not disappointed. However once we had booked and rather late read the reviews we were terrified we were going to be ripped off in a dirty unfriendly Hotel and nothing could have been further from the truth. We were in a party of 14 ladies and we were dealt with efficiently and with respect, we were a bit surprised that the rooms were slightly more expensive than quoted and there was a tax to pay so instead of paying 160 euros per night per room we ended up paying 180 euros. Our room was small but very clean and the bed was comfortable . We had large french windows which opened into the room and overlooked the canal, some of my friends were not as lucky and their rooms looked out onto a brick wall. Once the windows were closed the noise was shut out, even though we were centrally located sleep was not a problem. Breakfast was served in a bright airey very contemporary dining room, self service, bread, rolls, ham, cheese, jams, boiled and scrambled eggs, cereals, friut etc etc and you could even have full english if you want it! at an extra cost. Lashings of tea and coffee so you just cannot grumble. There is also a nice lounge area below the dining room that's cool where you can sit and relax on sqishy sofa's and you can leave your suitcase there on the day you depart rather than dragging it round Amsterdam with you as so many travellers seem to have to do. You have to be out of the room by 11am. Breakfast is served between 8am and 10am. There isn't any room service but hey you are in Amsterdam and just round the corner are all the cafe's, bars, restaurants and take-aways you could ever want. It was my first trip to Amsterdam, I loved the flower market, the boat trip, don't miss a trip to the ice Bar, truly remarkable but I paid a fortune for The Boomtown Comedy Bar and was bored to tears by the self indulgent actors who were not funny with their american type humour, give that a miss folks and spend your money on a nice meal and a few drinks, sit outside and watch life in all it's variety pass you by. Red Light district, not for me but had to see it, just felt sick at human depravity. Have a good trip and enjoy Hotel Ness it's okay, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but easy to reach everywhere”
Reviews.Author: emk1
Reviews.Content: Hotel have a small rooms but center of the city an d breakfast is good and price was 96 Euro/ in June 2004 BB inc. from booking.com.Rooms with a canal view are better but only 3-4 rooms

Reviews.Title: “A SHAMBLES!!!”
Reviews.Author: KristieScotland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here jan 2007, There was completely no customer service, our room door was not closing or locking we were repeatedly being trapped in our own room. It was awful, wouldnt recommend to anyone to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly-Priced, Decent Experience...Far from Great, though”
Reviews.Author: jeffpeff
Reviews.Content: My experience with the Hotel Nes was decidedly better than many of the reviews here. However, I can see how others could have had a worse experience than I did. Indeed, the location is great. About a 10 minute walk from the Red Light District and Dam square, but far-enough away so as to be in a quiet neighborhood. I paid 130 Euros a night for a room with two single beds (for one person), with a bathroom. Booked online with easytobook.com. No problems with the staff. They were friendly, efficient, and helpful. The public areas downstairs are indeed clean, tasteful, and pleasant. Breakfast was decent: Facilities were clean, food was good, with a good choice of items (though yes...Orange juice costs extra, which is sort-of a theme at this hotel...More in a moment). My room (number 8) was plenty-big enough for one, and would be fine for two, as well. A small desk, two chairs, a closet, two operable windows, and a standing floor fan. Bathroom was pretty small, but that's to be expected in Amsterdam. Standard bath amenities included (towels, soap, shampoo, shower cap). Overall, the hotel is a bit of a hodgepodge, as if they're still in the process of refurbishing: There are some stylish lamps and furnishings in the rooms, though the bathroom light was a spooky fluorescent disc that took some time to come up to full power (like, minutes). Bedding and towels were clean, but the inside of the door to my room had been patched with spackle (on a metal door), and as-yet unpainted. Not very attractive, but certainly not a big deal. As for the aforementioned 'theme': There is a computer terminal in the lobby. I asked how to access the internet with it, and was told that I'd need to buy a card from them for 6 Euros per hour to use it. The guy also (thankfully) offered that there are cheaper ways to get online in town at various internet cafes and coffeeshops...Which is true. So, no ripoff there. Later, I asked how to make a local phone call from my room. I was told that they had to 'turn on' the phone to access an outside line, and that it was 'expensive'. I just bought a sim card for my GSM phone instead for 15 euros. So, while they were fair-enough about suggesting cheaper alternatives to the requests I made, at the same time, my requests were pretty standard for guests' needs at a hotel, yet were seemingly 'out of the ordinary' at this place. And MY experience with the TV is as follows: Upon arrival and dumping my bag in my room, I turned on the TV to find a very poor picture on the screen, on a number of channels. I touched the dongle hanging from my room key to the 'eye' on the TV, and nothing improved. I later found out that this cost me 9 Euros for 'pay tv'. Never did see any improvement in the picture for the rest of the day, nor was I even given access to any other channels. The TV was utterly baffling: For a short while, I was getting a snowy version of BBC, which was great. But later on, I couldn't access that channel at all...The 'channel up' button would get me as far as channel 13 before automatically switching back to channel one after a few minutes. In fact, I still don't quite know how to turn the damn thing ON in the first place. You can push the power button all day, and nothing happens. But go to the bathroom, and when you come out, the TV has decided to turn on, after all. Totally and unnecessarily complicated. But...Who comes to Amsterdam to watch TV, anyway? So, in closing: The hotel Nes was well-priced for a city like Amsterdam, with a good location, and other than the silliness of the TV, I had no major complaints. But then, I only stayed two nights. If I were to stay there for more time that that, things might have gotten to me a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Not much for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nes was rather disappointing. The location was fantastic (I guess this is what you paid for...) and the downstairs lounge and breakfast restaurant were nice, clean and contemporary. HOWEVER once you got upstairs into the communal corridors and bedrooms it was a different story. We paid 315 Euro for 2 people for 2 nights including tax... my mother runs a Bed & Breakfast in the UK near the beach in beautiful South Devon which is cleaner, brighter, more comfortable and half the price. The communal corridors in Hotel Nes were dark and grimy, not sure when it had last seen a lick of paint. Our bedroom was tiny, did not have a bath, was not very clean, the bathroom smelt of the last occupier (along with several of the last occupiers hairs, yuck), there was one tiny single cupboard with 3 coathangers (not enough to service 2 guests), there were no tea or coffee making facilities, one chair to sit on, marks and scuffs on the walls, only one stand for one suitcase (no good when there is two of you!), and you had to pay extra to watch TV. The staff also left a lot to be desired. There appeared to be some quibble over my credit card when I arrived and the male receptionist told us very aggressively that he had almost sold our room as we were 'so late in arriving' (it was 3 in the afternoon and we had just driven from Germany, and they knew this because we had called the week before to check our booking and confirm our time of arrival), they denied all knowledge of the phone call. Then when I approached a different male receptionist to complain about the room, I was told to speak to a Duty Manager in the morning (this was about 6.30pm, not really an unsociable time to ask for a manager). I also witnessed a variety of general rudeness to other guests from male receptionists, including one who refused to take cash to pay for a room and insisted that the guest use his credit card instead. Each time I either handed the room key in, or asked for it when we came back, I was merely grunted at. The breakfast was plentiful but basic European fare, however you had to pay extra for orange juice (?). All in all I felt we did not get value for money, nor would we stay there again or recommend it to anyone else. My advice? - Stay in a FAMILY RUN hotel, or somewhere very expensive, that way you are guaranteed better service and a more caring attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatation”
Reviews.Author: TRAVLDAWG
Reviews.Content: I mainly chose this hotel for the location,very close to the rembrandtsplein with its various brown cafes, resturants and close to many gay bars.Since I stayed 8 nights ,I was given a front canal view on the 3rd floor wich was great. Since I read past reviews on how small the rooms were, I decided to splunge a little and take a double room.,sine I know from past visits how small the single rooms can be.The room was always kept clean the hotle was always very clean, not a bad breakfast. My only comlaint is that a couple of the front desk staff were a bit surly,except for the actual manager of the hotel who tried to be as acomadating as possible, even when asked for ice cubes he got it for me ,unlike the others. But who cares, didnt go to amsterdam to make freinds with them any way.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering how expensive Amsterdam is.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here overnight in Dec. 2005. We asked for a double, twin room and ended up with two twin beds pushed right up against each other. The room was pretty small, but we managed to separate the beds by a foot or so. The hotel is in pretty good shape and has a great breakfast area and lounge area downstairs. Its centrally located and only about a 10 minute walk to Dam Square or Leides Square. We payed 115 Euro per night for our room, which I though was expensive, but I guess not considering it was a weekend and everything else was 150 Euro and up. The staff is friendly and watched our bags for us the next after we checked out and were out sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Eeeekkk!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect example of the thievery of the city. Having visited Amsterdam many times, this was the only bad experience. The walls being thin is an understatement - I was put in a room with a twin bed - the room itself having literally 2 feet of space on three sides of the bed - smaller than a closet. Total rip off, very expensive for such a small room (on any standards). Location is nice, right across from Hotel L'Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: m888han
Reviews.Content: We arrived for one night in Amsterdam and managed to get a room from the central booking place in the centre at last minute. We were put in the top floor room of the annexe which was round the corner from the hotel. I would not recommend this room to the elderly or very unfit people! Carrying the suitcases up was a nightmare - well, it was for my boyfriend! The view of the canal and bridge was lovely although there I was quite surprised there was a lot of noise coming from loud drunk stag and hens and a lot of cars tooting their horns all night. We were woken many times until around 5am. There was also a draught coming from the side window which kept us quite chilly as we slept. The male receptionist wasn't too friendly either, not keen on helping you out with touristy questions. Breakfast was okay but they shouldn't be charging extra 3euros for orange juice! Nice area though.

Reviews.Title: “No room to swing a kitten, never mind a cat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was so tiny it was more like a cell, I could even touch the walls of the width of the room by holding a magazine in one hand and holding my hands out straight. The room was decorated in depressing dark brown with threadbare and cigerette burn hole matching bed linen and a wonderful view of a dingy courtyard. The bathroom was a wet room, so if you needed the toilet after you have had a shower you got wet feet. The breakfast was awful, no fresh fruit and fruit juice was an extra for 3 euros. I could go on for ever about how dire this hotel was but its only redeeming factor was the staff were relatively helpful and friendly(a taxi was successfully ordered and an extra blanket was delivered to room as requested) and the location was quite good

Reviews.Title: “Place is Lousy”
Reviews.Author: maroj15
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely lousy. The room is awful, the staff works very hard but only at being unfriendly to their guests, the staff kept me waiting outside for half an hour late at night before letting me in. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. Don't let them ruin your Amsterdam stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff an location”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousbigapple
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Nes is in a good location which is near shops an about 15 min walk from central station, i suggest asking a few taxis cabs for prices to the hotel from the airport to the hotel and from central station as 1 told Â£25 for a 5 min taxis ride to the hotel from central station and another told us Â£8 so be carful not to pay more than you need to! there are friendly and helpful staff at the hotel and they have good views of the canal. Rooms are very clean and you get clean towels everyday, they are small but convient and appropriate for the price you pay for them. The location in near to alot of the popular shops we have here like H&M and the puma shop etc. breakfast there is toast, meat, ceral an tea and coffe which is nice. i would definatly stay here again and i have no conplaints about my 4 day stay at the Hotel Nes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but --”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and my partner stayed at the Hotel Nes at the beginning of April. There was a problem with the booking, because the agency, who was dealing with the hotel, didn't get their contact details right, so when we said we would arrive a day late, the hotel didn't know about it. The hotel blamed the agency but nevertheless gave us a 50% discount on the first night. The absolutely tiny room was situated right underneath the sloping roof. The first thing I noticed was a foul stench coming from the cupboard. Then I was a bit shocked to find the bathroom ceiling sloping to the extent that it was only possible to have a shower kneeling down. I am also convinced that the bed cover was inhabited by flees. The breakfast also was rather disappointing. Nothing fresh and healthy and you had to order the orange juice for an extra 2 Euros. But the location is rather nice and the staff were quite friendly. My advice is to ask for a room below the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dd4287
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nes in August, 2003, and really enjoyed it. The location was great. Most sights were within easy walking distance, and for those that weren't, the tram was just a couple of blocks away. The hotel was clean, and the staff was nice. The only problem we had was that we requested a double room and were given a room with two twin beds (made up separately) pushed together. That tended to get a bit uncomfortable, as one of us kept falling between the beds or trying to pull back the covers that only covered half the bed. We had a room overlooking the street and canal, and were able to keep the window open at night for a nice breeze with very little street noise. We'll definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “great staff nice place”
Reviews.Author: EnglandScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with super-friendly staff. The room was small, but well-priced and in a super location. You can walk from Central Station, rather than tram, and save some money. The breakfast was kind of the same every day, but it was good, and the bread really fresh. I'd stay here again for sure.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Nes
HotelInfo.Address: Kloveniersburgwal 137-139, Amsterdam 1011, The Netherlands
